For all those that are new to Reckless Racing, you might start of thinking it feels a bit weird with the handling. For all those who played the original, you probably think they have screwed it up for this version. Well the fact is that once you start upgrading cars they feel and drive very differently. It is worth spending to the time to go through this process in Career mode and on that level it is also rewarding.  Graphics have had a huge bump. It all looks so good you will barley have time to notice all the details as you wizz around the dirt and tarmac roads.  The tracks in this game are awesome. Due to the variation in track layout on the same map, in can be confusing at first. If you leave map and race-line on in the settings, this will help you learn the course. Once you get decent, turn this off and get back to the challenge of the original. Like any racer, knowing the track is the key to winning. There are now more jumps and way more variation in track design - all of which makes for massive amounts of fun.  If you are into multi player and hate the server lag, try hot lap mode. This way you avoid ghost cars that just pop up in front of you and cause a crash.
